## Summary of Changes Hello @hdkz-dev, I'm Gemini Code Assist[^1]! I'm currently reviewing this pull request and will post my feedback shortly. In the meantime, here's a summary to help you and other reviewers quickly get up to speed! This pull request represents a significant consolidation and modernization effort, elevating the entire multi-game-engines workspace to a 'Zenith Tier' quality standard. The changes establish a highly robust, type-safe, and performant foundation, focusing on flexible engine integration and enhanced security. This prepares the project for future scaling and broader game engine support with maximum engineering stability. ### Highlights * **Project-wide Zero-Any Policy & Type Safety**: Eliminated all `any` and `as any` casts across the entire monorepo, including test code and utilities, achieving 100% type safety. This was complemented by reconstructing `PositionString`, `FEN`, and `SFEN` with proper inheritance to prevent type confusion. * **Modernized Dependency Stack**: Updated key dependencies to their latest stable 2026 versions, including React 19.2, Vue 3.5.28, Storybook 10.2.10, Vite 7.3, and ESLint 9.39.2, ensuring compatibility and leveraging new features. * **Generic Protocol Adapter Foundation**: Introduced generic protocol adapters (`@multi-game-engines/adapter-uci`, `-usi`, `-gtp`) and a configuration-driven engine generation mechanism. This allows dynamic loading of any compatible engine by specifying its URL and SRI, without requiring code changes. * **Enhanced Security and Domain Isolation**: Implemented strict FEN validation with whitelist checks and structural verification for build-time reliability. Worker origin validation was solidified to prevent cross-origin script execution, and domain-specific logic (e.g., chess, shogi) is now physically isolated into subpaths for pay-as-you-go bundling. * **Architectural Alignment and Documentation**: Refined the Facade pattern by strictly separating `IEngineAdapter` (internal) from `IEngine` (public) to resolve generic mismatch issues. A new `ZENITH_STANDARD.md` document was added to define the project's highest quality standards across various aspects.
Changelog * **docs/ARCHITECTURE.md** * Expanded the 'Pure Core & Pay-as-you-go' section to include domain isolation details. * Added a new section on 'Multi-game, Multi-engine support' explaining unique ID management and protocol reuse. * **docs/PROGRESS.md** * Updated the progress date to February 19, 2026. * Revised 'Achievement Highlights' to reflect Phase 3 Stage 2 completion, detailing zero-any policy, branded types, architectural alignment, FEN validation, security enhancements, and generic adapter foundation. * Updated 'Next Steps' to include research into extended adapters and building the generic adapter foundation. * **docs/ROADMAP.md** * Added 'Extended Adapters' and 'Multi-Engine Ensemble' to the project roadmap. * **docs/TASKS.md** * Marked 'Project-wide Zero-Any Policy' and 'Generic Adapters' as completed. * Added new tasks for Asian Variants, Incomplete Information, and specific game adapters. * **docs/TECHNICAL_SPECS.md** * Introduced UCCIParser for Chinese Chess and generic text parsers. * Expanded the 'Multi-Engine Support' section with details on generic adapters, ID separation, and parallel Worker execution. * **docs/ZENITH_STANDARD.md** * Added a new document outlining Zenith Tier quality standards for architecture, performance, developer experience, QA & accessibility, and security. * **docs/implementation_plans/extended-adapters-design.md** * Expanded the document with detailed sections for various game adapters like Backgammon, Checkers, Xiangqi, Janggi, and Gomoku. * Added a new section on multi-engine support and generic adapter design principles. * **docs/implementation_plans/generic-protocol-adapters.ja.md** * Added a new implementation plan detailing the construction of generic protocol adapters (UCI, USI, GTP, JSON) for dynamic engine loading. * **docs/implementation_plans/phase3-multi-engine-extended-games.ja.md** * Added a new implementation plan for Phase 3, focusing on multi-engine ensemble analysis and expanding support for various extended games. * **eslint.config.mjs** * Updated ESLint configuration to the new flat config format. * Enforced '@typescript-eslint/no-explicit-any' as an error. * Adjusted Storybook ESLint configuration for compatibility. * **examples/zenith-dashboard-vue/package.json** * Updated Vue to version 3.5.28. * Updated TypeScript ESLint plugin and parser versions. * **examples/zenith-dashboard-vue/pages/index.vue** * Updated imports for FEN/SFEN creation and board components to use domain-specific paths. * Refactored engine initialization to be asynchronous using `onMounted` and `ref`s. * Added error handling and display for engine initialization failures. * **examples/zenith-dashboard-vue/tsconfig.json** * Added path aliases for domain-specific core, adapter, and UI Vue packages. * **examples/zenith-dashboard/next.config.ts** * Added new adapter packages to the `transpilePackages` configuration. * **examples/zenith-dashboard/package.json** * Added `@multi-game-engines/adapter-katago` as a dependency. * Updated React and React DOM type definitions. * **examples/zenith-dashboard/src/app/page.tsx** * Updated imports for FEN/SFEN creation and board components to use domain-specific paths. * Refactored engine initialization to be asynchronous using `useState` and `useEffect`. * Added error handling and enhanced UI for engine initialization failures. * **examples/zenith-dashboard/src/lib/engines.ts** * Registered generic adapter factories (UCI, USI, GTP) with the EngineBridge for dynamic engine creation. * **examples/zenith-dashboard/tsconfig.json** * Added path aliases for domain-specific core, adapter, and UI React packages. * **mcp_config.example.json** * Added an example configuration file for Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers. * **package.json** * Updated pnpm overrides for `@rushstack/ts-command-line` and `@microsoft/api-extractor`. * Updated `eslint-plugin-storybook`, `turbo`, and `typescript-eslint` versions. * **packages/adapter-gtp/package.json** * Added a new package for the generic GTP (Go Text Protocol) adapter. * **packages/adapter-gtp/src/GTPAdapter.ts** * Implemented ## Code Review

This pull request is a significant, high-quality refactoring aimed at elevating the overall project quality to 'Zenith Tier', introducing a flexible architecture for dynamic engine loading and achieving high type safety. However, despite the inclusion of `validateWorkerUrl` for worker origin validation, two critical security issues were identified: a bypass in the origin validation for engine scripts and a potential path traversal vulnerability in the engine caching mechanism. Addressing these will be essential to fully meet the 'Zenith Tier' security standards.
